meanings.definition: A way in which something is usually done or a common practice.
meanings.sent1: Following the school's dress code is one of the conventions here.
meanings.sent2: At the party, it is a convention to bring a gift for the host.
meanings.sent3: The convention of wearing pajamas to work would be quite amusing!
meanings.sent4: Breaking the convention of waiting for your turn can lead to chaos.
meanings.sent5: The convention of shaking hands to greet someone is a sign of respect.

meanings.definition: A large meeting or conference for a particular industry or interest.
meanings.sent1: The annual technology convention attracts thousands of attendees.
meanings.sent2: She presented her research findings at the medical convention.
meanings.sent3: Imagine a convention where all they discuss is the color of socks!
meanings.sent4: The convention was a melting pot of ideas and innovations.
meanings.sent5: The convention hall buzzed with excitement and networking opportunities.

meanings.definition: A set of agreed upon rules or standards.
meanings.sent1: The company follows strict safety conventions in its operations.
meanings.sent2: It is important to adhere to the conventions of academic writing.
meanings.sent3: The convention of only eating dessert first would be quite unusual!
meanings.sent4: In literature, breaking conventions can create a unique style.
meanings.sent5: The conventions of politeness vary from culture to culture.
